availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Pennsylvania
County of Allegheny
City of Pittsburg } S.S

On this 27th day of January A. D. 1865, before me a Notary Public in and for said City, personally appeared Henry Holdship, to me well known, who having been duly sworn, doth depose and say: That having been appointed by "Letters Patent" dated January 16th A. D. 1865 issued by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky, in and for the State of Pennsylvania, he will well and truly, execute and perform all the duties of his station under said appointment --
Sworn and subscribed to on the day above written in testimony whereof I have hereunto placed my hand and affixed my seal of office.

figure.ab:
NOTARY PUBLIC, ALLEGHENY CO. PA.
C. H. ISRAELL

body.p:
Comr of Deeds
Oath of
Henry Holdship
Filed
2nd Feby 1865
